availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Carston A. Wandelohr (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and circuit court clerk)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and court clerk. Franklin County, Pennsylvania, native. Son of F. A. Wandelohr. Married to Eleanor Mullins Wandelohr in 1845. Father of Elizabeth Wandelohr, James K. Wandelohr, C. B. Wandelohr, and Annie Wandelohr. Married to Rachel Hitch Wanderlohr in Pendleton County on November 30, 1857. Father of Mary Wandelohr and Cora Wandelohr. Farmer in Pendleton County from 1845 to 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Pendleton County in 1860. Clerk of Pendleton Circuit Court in Pendleton County from 1862 to 1866.

W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, 7th ed. (Louisville: F. A. Battey and Company, 1887), 905.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, Film #000272801, p. 397.

“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1864,” in 1865 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1 (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1865), 9-12.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865,” in 1865/66 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1 (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1866), 9-12.
